content: On June 29, 1993, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Cincinnati Reds in a pivotal game that showcased the team's resilience. The Braves rallied from a 5-1 deficit to win 7-6, with David Justice hitting a crucial two-run homer in the eighth inning. This victory was part of the Braves' impressive 14-game winning streak that summer, which helped them secure the National League pennant and ultimately reach the World Series later that year.
